io.deepstream

Class DeepstreamClient

extends java.lang.Object
    deepstream.io java client

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      EventHandler event
      The entry point for events, such as EventHandler.subscribe(String, EventListener), EventHandler.emit(String) and provider functionality such as EventHandler.listen(String, ListenListener)
      RecordHandler record
      The getters for data-sync, such as RecordHandler.getRecord(String), RecordHandler.getList(String), provider functionality such as RecordHandler.listen(String, ListenListener) and single requests like RecordHandler.snapshot(String)
      RpcHandler rpc
      The entry point for rpcs, both requesting them via RpcHandler.make(String, Object) and providing them via RpcHandler.provide(String, RpcRequestedListener)

        public void setRuntimeErrorHandler(DeepstreamRuntimeErrorHandler deepstreamRuntimeErrorHandler)

      • login

        public LoginResult login()
                  throws DeepstreamLoginException
        Returns:
        The login result
        Throws:
        DeepstreamLoginException - Thrown if the user can no longer login due to multiple attempts or other fatal reasons
        See Also:
        Does not call the login callback, used mainly for anonymous logins where your guaranteed login

      • login

        public LoginResult login(com.google.gson.JsonElement authParams)
                  throws DeepstreamLoginException
        Send authentication parameters to the client to fully open the connection. Please note: Authentication parameters are send over an already established connection, rather than appended to the server URL. This means the parameters will be encrypted when used with a WSS / HTTPS connection. If the deepstream server on the other side has message logging enabled it will however be written to the logs in plain text. If additional security is a requirement it might therefor make sense to hash the password on the client. If the connection is not yet established the authentication parameter will be stored and send once it becomes available authParams can be any JSON serializable data structure and its up for the permission handler on the server to make sense of them, although something like { username: 'someName', password: 'somePass' } will probably make the most sense. login can be called multiple times until either the connection is authenticated or forcefully closed by the server since its maxAuthAttempts threshold has been exceeded
        Parameters:
        authParams - JSON.serializable authentication data
        Returns:
        The login result
        Throws:
        DeepstreamLoginException - Thrown if the user can no longer login due to multiple attempts or other fatal reasons

      • close

        public DeepstreamClient close()
        Closes the connection to the server.
        Returns:
        The deepstream client

      • addConnectionChangeListener

        public DeepstreamClient addConnectionChangeListener(ConnectionStateListener connectionStateListener)

      • getUid

        public java.lang.String getUid()
        Returns a random string. The first block of characters is a timestamp, in order to allow databases to optimize for semi- sequentuel numberings
        Returns:
        A unique id
